metadata.title: CVE-2017-5368 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
ZoneMinder v1.30 and v1.29, an open-source CCTV server web application, isvulnerable to CSRF (Cross Site Request Forgery) which allows a remoteattack to make changes to the web application as the current logged invictim. If the victim visits a malicious web page, the attacker cansilently and automatically create a new admin user within the webapplication for remote persistence and further attacks. The URL is/zm/index.php and sample parameters could include action=user uid=0newUser[Username]=attacker1 newUser[Password]=Password1234conf_password=Password1234 newUser[System]=Edit (among others).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5368` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zoneminder - 1.30.4+dfsg1-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zoneminder package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.30.4+dfsg1-5').
